Abstract: The concept of an RNA world posits that RNA molecules were pivotal in the early stages of life, serving both as genetic material and as catalysts. This study explores the multifaceted roles of RNA in gene expression and its implications for plant viruses and disease resistance. By examining the evolutionary trajectory of RNA, we gain insights into its adaptability and functionality in various biological processes. The research highlights the potential of RNA-based technologies in agriculture, offering innovative solutions for enhancing crop resilience and productivity. Furthermore, the study delves into the autobiographical journey of RNA research, tracing its historical milestones and future prospects. This comprehensive analysis underscores the significance of RNA in both the natural world and technological advancements, paving the way for novel applications in sustainable agriculture and beyond.
